swerve611×583 141 KB

How can I change the bottom plate to have a 1 inch gap for our 1 inch frame? If I fasten it there it gives an error and it looks like there’s no option for it in “change configuration”

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2024-02-01T15:49:22.274Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":36,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":202.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452913,"topic_slug":"mk4i-swerve-cad-help","display_username":"Will","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/5048fe1165ab0c4601182b65bbc7c9fbb58f787f.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49595,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1806 S.W.A.T. - Alumni/Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-swerve-cad-help/452913/1","custom_user_title":"1806 S.W.A.T. - Alumni/Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3299566,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T16:58:42.848Z","cooked":"

That’s not possible with the MKcad configurable swerve module since it’s not a standard configuration.

Ways you can do it

  1. Fast and easy, copy the lower plate, hide the one in the full module insert, and just mate the copy, and add shorter screws if you want.
  2. Import the MK4i step file yourself and modify, remate components all you want.
  3. Make a copy of the MKcad swerve document and make changes it to it (this is the longest process most likely) and then import from that document. If you do make a copy rename it something other than MKcad Swerve so it doesn’t show up in search results.
